page.title: 10CHURCHES:IRCHESTER & RUSHDEN
page.content: {St Mary's Church Rushden} stands on a rise in the ground at the southern end of the High Street. The present church was built on the site of another church which was mentioned in the Domesday Book.This was discovered when a wall of the old church was found during the re- laying of some floorboards.In the church is found the Pemberton Chapel which contains two recently restored monuments to the Pemberton family.The medieval windows date back to 1450. There are five full-stained and four half-stained.{St Katharine's Church, Irchester} was first mentioned in 1105 when it belonged to a Cluniac Priory. The church has been remodelled at var- ious times and some of the old doorways have been blocked off.The fine spire has recently been repaired.The tower is built of two types of coloured stones which give it a striped appearance.
